intro: Lavatera plebeia var. tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly lavatera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy, grayish foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, fluffy white or pink flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
